text.0: we compass thee like waters we whose grass is trimmed and soma pressed.
text.1: here where the filter pours its stream thy worshippers round thee o vṛtraslayer sit.
text.2: men vasu by the soma with lauds call thee to the foremost place.
text.3: when comest thou athirst unto the juice as home o indra like a bellowing bull.
text.4: boldly bold hero bring us spoil in thousands for the kaṇvas sake.
text.5: o active maghavan with eager prayer we crave the yellowhued with store ol kine.
text.6: medhyātithi to indra sing drink of the juice to make thee glad.
text.7: closeknit to his bay steeds boltarmed beside the juice is he his chariot is of gold.
text.8: he who is praised as strong of hand both right and left most wise and hold.
text.9: indra who rich in hundreds gathers thousands up honoured as breakerdown of forts.
text.10: the bold of heart whom none provokes who stands in bearded confidence.
text.11: muchlauded very glorious overthrowing foes strong helper like a bull with might.
text.12: who knows what vital ower he wins drinking beside the flowing juice.
text.13: this is the fairchecked god who joying in the draught breaks down the castles in his strength.
text.14: as a wild elephant rushes on this way and that way mad with heat.
text.15: none may compel thee yet come hither to the draught thou movest mighty in thy power.
text.16: when he the mighty neer oerthrown steadfast made ready for the fight.
text.17: when indra maghavan lists to his praisers call he will not stand aloof but come.
text.18: yea verily thou art a bull with a bulls rush whom none may stay.
text.19: thou mighty one art celebrated as a bull famed as a bull both near and far.
text.20: thy reins are very bulls in strength bulls strength is in thy golden whip.
text.21: thy car o maghavan thy bays are strong as bulls thou Śatakratu art a bull.
text.22: let the strong presser press for thee bring hither thou straightrushing bull.
text.23: the mighty makes the mighty run in flowing streams for thee whom thy bay horses bear.
text.24: come thou most potent indra come to drink the savoury soma juice.
text.25: maghavan very wise will quickly come to hear the songs the prayer the hymns of praise.
text.26: when thou hast mounted on thy car let thy yoked bay steeds carry thee.
text.27: past other mens libations lord of hundred powers thee vṛtraslayer thee our friend.
text.28: o thou most lofty one accept our laud as nearest to thine heart.
text.29: may our libations be most sweet to make thee glad o somadrinker heavenly lord.
text.30: neither in thy decree nor mine but in anothers he delights.
text.31: the man who brought us unto this.
text.32: indra himself hath said the mind of woman brooks not discipline.
text.34: his pair of horses rushing on in their wild transport draw his car.
text.36: cast down thine eyes and look not up more closely set thy feet let none.
text.37: see what thy garment veils for thou a brahman hast become a dame.
